column5: I just learned that a member of OFC dropped some food off at our house on New Years Day. My kids thanked them and they left in a hurry not wanting to be given credit I assume. I have been battling cancer and just before Christmas we were informed that Kingston General Hospital cancer clinic can no longer assist me and they could not say how much time I have left. I will be going to Princess Margaret Hospital on Monday in hopes that they have some meds that will keep me around longer.  Again I don't know who you are but my family and I thank you, it was someone in a blue Chevy pickup fairly new model.  Regards, Sam

Sorry to hear of this dreaded disease has struck you... hope you can get the help you need there as they did a lot with Waynes daughter l believe it was there. The gift to received from someone from the OFC Family does not surprise me at all. Prayers for you my friend
Sorry to hear that Sam, it's a lousy disease and hopefully Princess Margaret has some good news for you.  My wife beat it last year so don't ever give up hope bud.

Well Sam you're headed to the right place, PMH and Mount Sinai pretty much work together and have the best of the best within their walls. In the 5 years we spent running the halls there they made leaps and bounds in advancement. Hopefully they have the right ticket for you!

Not something you want to read about. Hang in brother OFC er, it's amazing what the medics can do today. There are many survivors of this crap disease,myself included. I only have to get an annual checkup, 4 years since surgery. You can join the club too. My sis-in-law got to ring the golden bell just last week. She was given 6 months to a year 2 years ago and she rang the all clear to live your life bell. So can you.  Whomever donated the food, you are the bomb.

Do not give up the ship. The Mrs is still doing fine since treatment completed over 2 years back. The brother-in-law is still hanging in despite a number of inoperable tumors. He has now gone 2 Christmases longer than expected. thanks to PMH.
Best of luck to you, I hope PMH can help.  sounds like a nice gesture as well.
Sorry to hear this dreaded disease has struck you.  Good luck!  To the person who donated the food for our fellow OFCer - you are truly an angel!
Sam, so very sorry to hear about the health .... but you are a strong bugger ....  Still remember talking Walleye in December in your old shop.  Be well and remember, be positive.
A little prayer sent my friend, wish there was more I could do!

Best of luck! Princess Margaret has wonderful facities from what Ive heard. My mother is battling with lung/liver cancer and has crippled her.  Having meals/food dropped off is such a huge help! There's a lot of caring helpful people In this world! Keep fighting!
Sorry you are going through this, try to be strong and remember, we are all here for you.  To the Angel that dropped off the food, God Bless You!!!
Wishing you the best possible outcome at Princess Margaret. I've heard they're the best!  hang in there ... there are better days ahead!
I'm pulling for you Sam. To whoever dropped off the package you're a good man.
Prayers sent your way   You have heard encouraging words from others. Be strong and hats off to the member who took time to give of their heart
Stay positive and fight!

That is not great news. But, that said, some of the best in the country are there at PMH. Do not give up hope. Ask for any options they have be it conventional or experimental. Good luck and kudos to whomever dropped off some food to you.
sorry to hear and pray for the best possible outcome And when in need do not hesitate to ask no one on this board or there familys shall ever go hungary or cold in my books

Sending you prayers!!!   Hang in there and fight it!  Many stories of people that have done it and I'm sure all of us would love to hear another one.  Kudos to whomever dropped off food, incredible gesture.
Sam....so sorry to hear of your cancer.  Keep up the good fight.  We're all pulling for you!   I hope PMH offers some good news!
Lots of brothers and sisters pulling for you here. One of which, made the kindest of gestures! That's why I love this place!  Godspeed
That was a true act of kindness. Nice to be a part of this group. Hang in there Sam!
Sorry to hear Sam hope will keep you going. As to the food angel who ever you are THANKS you are the reason we fight so hard to keep this site open and healthy.    Art
